security: This document lists individuals and foundations used by the CIA, some wittingly and some unwittingly, to conduct covert operations. It also details how to respond if the foundations' connection to the CIA is exposed. "Each Vernon Fund board member is being advised that he will receive a copy of the NEA and WCOTP letters regarding press allegations; he will acknowledge his membership on the Vernon Fund board if confronted with the facts; he will acknowledge that the Vernon Fund has supported WCOTP and that it made a few small grants to NEA; he will decline any further comment on the origin or operation of the Vernon Fund, on sources of Vernon Fund money, on whether the Vernon Fund received money from the Agency, or any other aspect of the Fund..."
summary: This memorandum outlines CIA's connections to Brown & Root, Inc., various foundations (BROWN Foundation, VARNON Fund, CABOT Foundation, San Jacinto Fund, M. D. ANDERSON Foundation, MARSHALL Foundation, HOBBY Foundation), and individuals used for covert projects, including responses to potential exposure of these connections.
summary_one_paragraph: The memorandum, dated December 20, 1967, addresses a Ramparts article concerning the CIA's ties with Brown & Root, Inc. and provides details on various individuals and foundations connected to CIA projects. It outlines contact approvals for Brown & Root employees, notes the vulnerability of certain foundations (BROWN, MARSHALL, San Jacinto) to exposure due to Agency funding links, and details the use of the VERNON Fund as a cover for Project DILAMPREY. The document includes instructions for board members of the VERNON Fund on how to respond if questioned about the fund's Agency connections and also mentions security approvals for individuals like William G. CARR and Bryce REA, Jr., along with various projects such as LPCOIN, DUGLANT, and CARNIVAL.
